subject: Update Intel Wireless Bluetooth chip firmware
commitMessage:
Update Intel Wireless Bluetooth chip firmware

Commit log from the bluez mailing list:

This patch updates firmware patch files for following Intel Bluetooth devices:
- Intel Wireless Bluetooth 7260
- Intel Wireless Bluetooth 3160

This patch fixes
- Issue with LED blinking
- Issue with USB
- No SCO data over EHCI

Bug-Tizen: TIVI-2797

Change-Id: Ifcda40a5227c40a69367fe4c7626f8c1808e344f
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

This patch for BT firmware made the hfg calls to work in vtc1010. I can't comment if it has any effect on other functionality in Bluetooth, but I doubt it.

Patch Set 1:

Jaska did you actually hear sound?  For me all I get is static when using my Moto G.

Patch Set 1:

Both Brian and Jimmy tried this patch on VTC 1010 and only got static.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Jaska double-verified on both VTC1010 and Byt-BB.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: packaging: update the changelog (BT firmware to IVI)
commitMessage:
packaging: update the changelog (BT firmware to IVI)

Signed-off-by: Artem Bityutskiy <artem.bityutskiy@linux.intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        succeeded      

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       armv7l         succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

Is this still the recommended practice to update changelog in a separate commit? Just because need commit SHA1 in changelog?
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

Well, I think it just makes a lot of sense to keep functional and packaging changes separate. In my specific case the "functional" change was also about changing the packaging, but nevertheless.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

The tag submit/tizen/20130805.142835 is pushed, but this submission failed because of following reason(s):

- The commit 8248a714a3e2fb6d087b78507eaa58ef57cf393c is still under review in gerrit. After reviewer accpet this commit, it will be submitted to OBS corresponding project.

you need to conflict with main package because you are including the same files in both packages.

Patch Set 1:

Anas, I'll fix the problem you identified in a later commit.

Patch Set 1:

The other thing, there is nothing IVI specific about this firmware, so you should call the package based on the device name and not -ivi.
Actually it makes sense to split linux-firmware in its entirety based on firmwares and devices supported and pull the device firmware based on the platform you are installing. It is now a big chunk of binaries that we install without any discrimination
